conclusion: Object A and Object B start moving from the same location in the same direction.
The graph shows the relationship between the velocities of Object A and Object B over time.
At time $t_1$, the velocity of Object A is increasing, and the velocity of Object B is decreasing.
The acceleration of Object A is positive because its velocity is increasing.
The acceleration of Object B is negative because its velocity is decreasing.
Since the accelerations have opposite signs, the two objects do not have the same acceleration at time $t_1$.
